newsitem.title: CHINA: China calls for tighter control of inward capital.
newsitem.headline: China calls for tighter control of inward capital.

text.p: Developing countries in Asia must strengthen control over the large inward flows of foreign capital, the governor of China's central bank said.

The increasing inflow of such capital into the countries of East and Southeast Asia is a good thing, the Shanghai Securities News on Sunday quoted Dai Xianglong, governor of the People's Bank of China, as telling a meeting in Beijing of central bank governors and top finance officials from the region.
Central banks must strengthen management over this inflow and adopt a more cautious policy, Dai said.
This management must accord with the economic conditions of each country and its ability to repay debt, he said.
At the same time, countries must eagerly promote financial reform and set up effective risk prevention mechanisms and gradually get rid of budgetary and overall deficits, he said.

Countries must improve policy co-ordination over domestic and foreign currencies and use more effective measures over rising foreign exchange reserves, to prevent a rise in money supply, Dai said but gave no more details.
